p: The chloroformic fungal extract showed significant inhibition against the mutagenicity of S9-dependent mutagen, 2-aminofluorene (2-AF). In case of co- incubation, inhibitory effect ranged from 21.9 to 67.1% with IC 50 0.79 mg/ml while in case of pre incubation mode, it ranged from 30.4 -70% with IC 50 0.35 mg/ml. This demonstrated good inhibitory effect in case of pre incubation as compared to co incubation. The chloroformic extract was found to be neither mutagenic nor toxic to the Salmonella typhimurium strain as the number of colonies was comparable to spontaneous mode which did not contain any mutagen. A significant difference ( p < 0.05) was observed between the various concentrations as revealed by one way ANOVA followed by post hoc Tukey’s t-test (Table 1).
